<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>Stocks crumbled, and the tech-focused Nasdaq posted its </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/27/-stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst day</a></span><span> since March due to a spike in bond yields. We’ll unpack that in just a bit.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the US needs to do something about the debt ceiling </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/yellen-debt-ceiling-pelosi-congress-default-acfe373c-44d4-470a-9d77-2f4e53853699.html" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">by October 18</a></span><span>, or else risk defaulting on its loans shortly after. Senate Republicans blocked a Democrat-proposed bill to raise the debt ceiling on Monday, which will likely force the Dems to tack on the debt ceiling measure to their budget bill.</span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/what-the-surging-10-year-yield-is-trying-to-tell-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Talking the Birds and the Bonds
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/what-the-surging-10-year-yield-is-trying-to-tell-us?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Man walking in front of the NYSE" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fd1a1849f77f19551e2c465f43c701fbef031d5c-6240x4160.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Spencer Platt/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">10-year Treasury yields rose for their sixth straight day on Tuesday to their <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/27/-stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest level</a> since June. And while the 10-year note may not be the main conversation topic in your group chat, investors pay close attention to it as a benchmark for borrowing costs and future economic growth.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Quick note:</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>Bond yields </span><span><a href="https://www.thebalance.com/why-do-bond-prices-and-yields-move-in-opposite-directions-417082?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">move inversely</a></span><span> to prices, so yields increase when investors sell bonds.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what is the 10-year trying to tell us? </strong>By selling off bonds, investors are preparing for the Fed to wind down its economic stimulus measures later this fall and an interest rate hike in the not-too-distant future.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Surging yields also signal that higher inflation could <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/28/us-bonds-10-year-treasury-yield-spikes-amid-inflation-fears.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">last longer</a> than expected, a reality that Fed Chair Jerome Powell acknowledged in remarks on Capitol Hill yesterday. (Don’t look now, but used car prices are <a href="https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1442913151779885061?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on the rise</a> again, too.)</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tech companies were hit the hardest</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Despite all three major indexes tumbling yesterday, one was not like the rest. The Nasdaq, which is more focused on the tech sector than the S&P or Dow, got bruised the most.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Wall Street’s top tech names, such as Nvidia, Facebook, and Amazon, lost </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-28/top-u-s-tech-stocks-set-to-bleed-130-billion-as-yields-rise?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $200 billion</a></span><span> in market value.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rising yields don’t necessarily spell doom for stocks. In fact, right now they appear to be signaling that a more “normal” economy—one that doesn’t require unprecedented government stimulus—is arriving.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But high-growth tech stocks can take a hit when yields spike. These companies are expensive relative to their current earnings, and are priced based on their growth prospects five or 10 years down the road (see: Tesla’s mammoth $770 billion market cap). Rising yields, and the higher returns they offer investors, can make bonds more attractive relative to riskier stocks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Some market watchers were concerned about a choppy September, and they’ve been proven right—the S&P is on pace for its first monthly loss since January.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/chinese-factories-go-offline-as-power-crunch-bites?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
That Energy Crunch Energy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/chinese-factories-go-offline-as-power-crunch-bites?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A shuttered factory" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/c38043696b8e9b9066e3b28c3eda447940459ddb-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re not experiencing an energy crisis, are you even a country in 2021? As the UK confronts its own gas shortages, a widespread <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-27/why-china-is-facing-a-power-crunch-and-what-it-means-quicktake?utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&utm_content=nextchina&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">energy crunch</a> in China has led to power cuts and forced a chunk of its muscular manufacturing sector offline.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Goldman Sachs became the latest bank to <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-58704200?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut China’s GDP forecast</a> on account of the energy shortages. It calculates that up to 44% of the country’s industrial activity has been affected.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on?</strong> A couple of things.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beijing has instituted tougher emissions standards to curb the country’s coal use, which accounts for more than 70% of China’s electricity generation. Current production is not meeting demand.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The soaring price of coal has made producing electricity an unprofitable endeavor, so utilities aren’t exactly rushing to make more.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters:</strong> Add China’s electricity shortage to the laundry list of problems crimping the global supply chain, which is about to come under even more pressure ahead of the holiday shopping season.<em>—SQ</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/amazon-has-created-the-robot-from-rocky-iv?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Has Created the Robot From 'Rocky IV'
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/amazon-has-created-the-robot-from-rocky-iv?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Amazon Astro robot, rotating around and blinking" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/50e4e93041443ef2348f600d7065e04025de7af7-2000x1124.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/28/amazon-event-2021-live-updates-amazons-set-to-announce-new-products.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fall product event </a>on Tuesday, Amazon announced its first home robot: a distinguished little gentleman named Astro that looks kind of like a Kindle glued to a travel toaster oven.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Astro can keep a watchful eye on pets, children, and would-be home invaders, all while topping out at <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/28/cnn-underscored/astro-amazon-robot-hands-on/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">speeds of 2 mph</a>. Users will be able to set boundary limits on which rooms Astro can enter, and even make it beatbox. It’s basically a very slow guard dog that can’t use the stairs and also has a cupholder.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Astro is $999 for Day One purchasers, and will cost $1,499 once widely released.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Other products announced at the event:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Always Home Cam: a security drone that will fly around your home when you aren’t there and have a will-they-won’t-they thing with Astro, probably</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Halo View: a fitness band à la Fitbit</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hey Disney: a Disney-themed voice assistant working alongside Alexa</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Alexa Together: a subscription service aimed at helping users care for elderly loved ones</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A $60 smart thermostat to take on Google’s Nest</span><span><em>—MK</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Have no fear, your favorite food isn’t in jeopardy. Quite the contrary, in fact, thanks to <a href="https://www.piestro.com/?utm_source=rgapielandingpage&utm_medium=partnership01_09-30" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Piestro</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Piestro is the robotic pizzeria you <em>knead </em>(sorry) to know about. Not only does it make artisanal pies at a fraction of the cost of traditional pizzerias, it also thinks you should join the pizza revolution as an investor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Seems that plenty of others are excited about Piestro’s potential too, considering <strong style="color:#000">their robots </strong><strong style="color:#000">have received $580M in pre-orders via commercial contracts</strong>. That’s a lotta cheese...and a delicious investment opportunity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Your chance to invest ends TOMORROW, 9/30.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.piestro.com/?utm_source=rgapielandingpage&utm_medium=partnership01_09-30" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get in on the future of artisanal pizza with Piestro here</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Candidates stand in line before taking the Rajasthan Eligibility Exam for Teachers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/319127102213ae8155e34979ee24aa027c6d694e-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Candidates stand in line before taking the Rajasthan Eligibility Exam for Teachers. Vishal Bhatnagar/NurPhoto via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>India shut down the internet for <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/28/tech/india-rajasthan-reet-exam-internet-shutdown-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 25 million people</a> across the state of Rajasthan on Sunday. Why? To prevent cheating at a time when hundreds of thousands of candidates took a standardized test to become eligible for teaching roles.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You have acted to make our banking system less safe, and that makes you a dangerous man to head up the Fed and that is why I will oppose your renomination.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At a Senate hearing yesterday, Sen. Elizabeth Warren told Fed Chair Jerome Powell to his face that she doesn’t think he <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-28/warren-says-she-opposes-powell-for-second-term-as-fed-chair?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deserves</a> another four years in the position. President Biden must decide whether to reappoint Powell, who has broad bipartisan support, before his term expires in February.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Is going to the office a broken way of working? <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PEOPLE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/macarthur-fellow-joshua-miele-creates-technology-for-the-blind?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Meet 2021 MacArthur Fellow: Joshua Miele
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/28/macarthur-fellow-joshua-miele-creates-technology-for-the-blind?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A picture of Joshua Miele" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/60266b25cadfa78651e16c6baeaf251ab8ca7c82-1322x744.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MacArthur Foundation</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every year, the MacArthur Foundation awards $625,000 apiece to 25 individuals doing <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/28/arts/macarthur-genius-grant-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remarkable things</a> in their respective fields—and no field’s off limits: Winners range from poets to humanitarians to, in Miele’s case, a designer at Amazon.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a nutshell, Miele creates accessible technology for blind people like himself. When he was four, he was blinded by a neighbor who poured sulfuric acid on him, and he’s been advocating for the blind community since. “I want to be famous for the right reasons, for the work I’ve done, and not for some stupid thing that happened to me 40 years ago,” he told the NYT in 2013.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are some of the <a href="https://www.macfound.org/fellows/class-of-2021/joshua-miele?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">amazing projects</a> Miele has led:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fire tablets that are Braille-compatible, and a “Show and Tell” feature on Echo devices that can identify different foods and pantry items</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Tactile maps” for the Bay Area’s BART train—known for ferrying tech workers to and from San Francisco and the suburbs—that users can explore with their fingers and an audio smart pen</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“</span><span><a href="https://youdescribe.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouDescribe</a></span><span>,” a platform that crowdsources audio descriptions for popular videos</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ </strong>Read Miele’s backstory <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2013/03/03/nyregion/40-years-after-an-acid-attack-a-life-well-lived.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>, and learn more about the 24 other 2021 MacArthur fellows <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/28/1037957309/macarthur-genius-grants-full-list-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did you know? Next year's Met Gala theme is "Newsletters." And if you want to rock the same look as this definitely not not Photoshopped pic of Kim K., we're here to make your dream a reality. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To get Brew joggers, all you need to do is refer <strong style="color:#000"><em>5 people</em> </strong>to the Brew this week using <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/refer-a-friend?access_token={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">your unique link</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The details:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Regardless of how many people you’ve already referred, you need to get at least 5 </span><span><em>new</em></span><span> confirmed referrals by October 3rd to win joggers.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Only the first 2,000 people to hit this threshold will get joggers, so lock them in now.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Only participants with a US address can win.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/refer-a-friend?access_token={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Grab your joggers here</a>.</p>
</div>

We’ll unpack that in just a bit.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTreasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the US needs to do something about the debt ceiling \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/yellen-debt-ceiling-pelosi-congress-default-acfe373c-44d4-470a-9d77-2f4e53853699.html\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eby October 18\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, or else risk defaulting on its loans shortly after. Senate Republicans blocked a Democrat-proposed bill to raise the debt ceiling on Monday, which will likely force the Dems to tack on the debt ceiling measure to their budget bill.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e10-year Treasury yields rose for their sixth straight day on Tuesday to their \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/27/-stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest level\u003c/a\u003e since June. And while the 10-year note may not be the main conversation topic in your group chat, investors pay close attention to it as a benchmark for borrowing costs and future economic growth.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eQuick note:\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBond yields \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.thebalance.com/why-do-bond-prices-and-yields-move-in-opposite-directions-417082?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emove inversely\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to prices, so yields increase when investors sell bonds.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what is the 10-year trying to tell us? \u003c/strong\u003eBy selling off bonds, investors are preparing for the Fed to wind down its economic stimulus measures later this fall and an interest rate hike in the not-too-distant future.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSurging yields also signal that higher inflation could \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/28/us-bonds-10-year-treasury-yield-spikes-amid-inflation-fears.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elast longer\u003c/a\u003e than expected, a reality that Fed Chair Jerome Powell acknowledged in remarks on Capitol Hill yesterday. (Don’t look now, but used car prices are \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1442913151779885061?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon the rise\u003c/a\u003e again, too.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTech companies were hit the hardest\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDespite all three major indexes tumbling yesterday, one was not like the rest. The Nasdaq, which is more focused on the tech sector than the S\u0026P or Dow, got bruised the most.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWall Street’s top tech names, such as Nvidia, Facebook, and Amazon, lost \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-28/top-u-s-tech-stocks-set-to-bleed-130-billion-as-yields-rise?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $200 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in market value.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRising yields don’t necessarily spell doom for stocks. In fact, right now they appear to be signaling that a more “normal” economy—one that doesn’t require unprecedented government stimulus—is arriving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut high-growth tech stocks can take a hit when yields spike. These companies are expensive relative to their current earnings, and are priced based on their growth prospects five or 10 years down the road (see: Tesla’s mammoth $770 billion market cap). Rising yields, and the higher returns they offer investors, can make bonds more attractive relative to riskier stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSome market watchers were concerned about a choppy September, and they’ve been proven right—the S\u0026P is on pace for its first monthly loss since January.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re not experiencing an energy crisis, are you even a country in 2021? As the UK confronts its own gas shortages, a widespread \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-27/why-china-is-facing-a-power-crunch-and-what-it-means-quicktake?utm_campaign=socialflow-organic\u0026utm_content=nextchina\u0026utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=social\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenergy crunch\u003c/a\u003e in China has led to power cuts and forced a chunk of its muscular manufacturing sector offline.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoldman Sachs became the latest bank to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-58704200?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut China’s GDP forecast\u003c/a\u003e on account of the energy shortages. It calculates that up to 44% of the country’s industrial activity has been affected.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on?\u003c/strong\u003e A couple of things.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeijing has instituted tougher emissions standards to curb the country’s coal use, which accounts for more than 70% of China’s electricity generation. Current production is not meeting demand.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe soaring price of coal has made producing electricity an unprofitable endeavor, so utilities aren’t exactly rushing to make more.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters:\u003c/strong\u003e Add China’s electricity shortage to the laundry list of problems crimping the global supply chain, which is about to come under even more pressure ahead of the holiday shopping season.\u003cem\u003e—SQ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEvery year, the MacArthur Foundation awards $625,000 apiece to 25 individuals doing \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/28/arts/macarthur-genius-grant-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremarkable things\u003c/a\u003e in their respective fields—and no field’s off limits: Winners range from poets to humanitarians to, in Miele’s case, a designer at Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a nutshell, Miele creates accessible technology for blind people like himself. When he was four, he was blinded by a neighbor who poured sulfuric acid on him, and he’s been advocating for the blind community since. “I want to be famous for the right reasons, for the work I’ve done, and not for some stupid thing that happened to me 40 years ago,” he told the NYT in 2013.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere are some of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.macfound.org/fellows/class-of-2021/joshua-miele?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eamazing projects\u003c/a\u003e Miele has led:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFire tablets that are Braille-compatible, and a “Show and Tell” feature on Echo devices that can identify different foods and pantry items\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Tactile maps” for the Bay Area’s BART train—known for ferrying tech workers to and from San Francisco and the suburbs—that users can explore with their fingers and an audio smart pen\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://youdescribe.org/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eYouDescribe\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” a platform that crowdsources audio descriptions for popular videos\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+
